author: chfast
content: This makes every section mandatory (type, code, data). Also the code section still cannot be empty. Does anyone think this is a problem (e.g. too much boilerplate)? I've seen voices asking to make everything optional (e.g. having data section only).

author: crypdough.eth
content: What are the odds that if the code_section == Nil, we can place a single opcode in there like INVALID or NOOP. My rationale is that we maximize benefits from standardized checks across the container format without losing flexibility

author: _shemnon
content: Three bytes to explicitly say "no data."  Less conditionals also simplifies the parser logic which unlocks some optimization options.  However a simpler parser is better for reference implementations.

author: _shemnon
content: CALLCODE is a broken opcode supplanted by DELEGATECALL.  Deprecating SELFDESTRUCT is to support the widly held desire to remove it for stuff like verkle.  If we do need it it's easier to re-add it, removing it requires a major EOF version bump, so we are trying to get in as much as we can.
